definition.text: API calls producee responses. Under this section they are defined.

paragraphs.text: For a single API Endpoint an API Server might have different possible responses. Each response type is differentiated from each other by the response code / status.

Each child of this node is a different response code / status from the API Server. Users need to add at least the most common response code (200) in order to start testing this API Endpoint. After that is recommended to add all other response codes as well, otherwise the API Data Fetcher Bot will stop when an unhandled response code is received.
